main event: Multiple UFO sightings and investigations were reported in Sweden, involving oval, silvery objects and unusual substances dropped from the objects.
interesting points: The sighting in Sweden involved residents of Halsingberg observing an oval, silvery object with a reddish-orange glow, approximately 10 meters in diameter.
Competent authorities in Sweden found a fine, fibrous, gossamer-like substance, similar to spider web, dropped from the object, which was examined by the Air Force's scientific engineering center.
Analysis of the material suggested it may be of a relatively high dielectric nature, containing metallic particles irregularly distributed within the material.
It was suggested to carefully examine the area for any residual radiation and conduct ground or low-level searches for additional details about the sighting.

The Swedish Air Force Intelligence indicated that many of the reported UFO sightings were Soviet attempts to test Swedish radar and other defensive installations, raising the possibility of foreign involvement.
sighted object: oval, silvery UFO with reddish-orange glow and substances dropped from the object
